SEARCH
Module it.polimi.ingsw.is24am03
Package it.polimi.ingsw.is24am03.server.controller

Class GameController

java.lang.Object
java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
it.polimi.ingsw.is24am03.server.controller.GameController
All Implemented Interfaces:
RemoteGameController, Serializable, Remote
public class GameController extends UnicastRemoteObject implements RemoteGameController
The game controller ensures the communication between client controller and server model. Acts as a remote controller for the game.
See Also:
  • Serialized Form

    • createGame

      public void createGame(int numPlayers, String nickname, String connectionType) throws GameAlreadyCreatedException
      Creates a new game with the specified number of players, nickname, and connection type.
      Specified by:
      createGame in interface RemoteGameController
      Parameters:
      numPlayers - the number of players for the game
      nickname - the nickname of the player creating the game
      connectionType - the type of connection (e.g., "RMI")
      Throws:
      GameAlreadyCreatedException - if a game has already been created
      IllegalArgumentException - if the nickname is blank or the number of players is invalid

    • canSelectStartingFace

      public void canSelectStartingFace(String player, String face) throws PlayerNotInTurnException, InvalidStateException, GameNotExistingException, ArgumentException, UnknownPlayerException
      Checks if a player can select their starting face.
      Specified by:
      canSelectStartingFace in interface RemoteGameController
      Parameters:
      player - the nickname of the player
      face - the chosen face ("FRONT" or "BACK")
      Throws:
      PlayerNotInTurnException - if it is not the player's turn
      InvalidStateException - if the game state does not allow selecting a starting face
      GameNotExistingException - if the game does not exist
      ArgumentException - if the face is not "FRONT" or "BACK"
      UnknownPlayerException - if the player is unknown or not part of the game

    • canDrawGold

      public void canDrawGold(String player) throws PlayerNotInTurnException, InvalidStateException, GameNotExistingException, EmptyDeckException, UnknownPlayerException
      Checks if the specified player can draw a gold card based on game rules and current state.
      Specified by:
      canDrawGold in interface RemoteGameController
      Parameters:
      player - The nickname of the player attempting to draw a gold card.
      Throws:
      PlayerNotInTurnException - If it's not the player's turn to perform this action.
      InvalidStateException - If the game state does not allow drawing a gold card.
      GameNotExistingException - If the game model is null, indicating the game does not exist.
      EmptyDeckException - If the gold deck is empty and no cards can be drawn.
      UnknownPlayerException - If the specified player is not part of the game or is not connected.

    • drawGold

      public void drawGold(String player)
      Allows the specified player to draw a gold card from the game model. This method assumes that all necessary validations (like player's turn and game state) have been performed before calling this method.
      Specified by:
      drawGold in interface RemoteGameController
      Parameters:
      player - The nickname of the player who is drawing the gold card.

    • canDrawTable

      public void canDrawTable(String player, int choice) throws PlayerNotInTurnException, InvalidStateException, GameNotExistingException, NullCardSelectedException, UnknownPlayerException, IllegalArgumentException
      Draws a table card for the player based on the choice provided.
      Specified by:
      canDrawTable in interface RemoteGameController
      Parameters:
      player - the player who is drawing the table card
      choice - the choice indicating which table card to draw
      Throws:
      PlayerNotInTurnException - if the player is not currently in turn //* @throws FullHandException if the player's hand is already full
      InvalidStateException - if the game state is not suitable for drawing table cards
      GameNotExistingException - if the game does not exist.
      NullCardSelectedException - if the selected card is null.
      UnknownPlayerException - if the player is unknown.
      IllegalArgumentException - if there is an argument error.

    • drawTable

      public void drawTable(String player, int choice)
      Allows the specified player to draw a card from the table based on the given choice. This method assumes that all necessary validations (like player's turn and game state) have been performed before calling this method.
      Specified by:
      drawTable in interface RemoteGameController
      Parameters:
      player - The nickname of the player who is drawing a card from the table.
      choice - The choice indicating which card from the table to draw.

    • addPlayer

      public void addPlayer(String player, String ConnectionType) throws FullLobbyException, NicknameAlreadyUsedException, IllegalArgumentException, GameNotExistingException
      Adds a player to the game.
      Specified by:
      addPlayer in interface RemoteGameController
      Parameters:
      player - the player to be added
      ConnectionType - the type of connection (e.g., RMI, Socket).
      Throws:
      FullLobbyException - if the lobby is already full
      NicknameAlreadyUsedException - if the provided nickname is already used by another player
      GameNotExistingException - if the game does not exist.
      IllegalArgumentException

    • placeCard

      public void placeCard(String player, int choice, int i, int j, String face) throws PlayerNotInTurnException, InvalidStateException, RemoteException, GameNotExistingException, CoordinatesOutOfBoundsException, NoCardsAvailableException, RequirementsNotMetException, ArgumentException, UnknownPlayerException
      Places a card on the table for the player.
      Specified by:
      placeCard in interface RemoteGameController
      Parameters:
      player - the player placing the card
      choice - the card to be placed
      i - the row index for placement
      j - the column index for placement
      face - whether the card should be placed face up or not
      Throws:
      PlayerNotInTurnException - if the player is not currently in turn
      InvalidStateException - if the game state is not suitable for placing cards
      RemoteException - if a remote communication error occurs.
      GameNotExistingException - if the game does not exist.
      CoordinatesOutOfBoundsException - if the coordinates are out of bounds.
      NoCardsAvailableException - if there are no cards available.
      RequirementsNotMetException - if the requirements are not met.
      ArgumentException - if there is an argument error.
      UnknownPlayerException - if the player is unknown.

    • canPickColor

      public void canPickColor(String player, String color) throws PlayerNotInTurnException, InvalidStateException, GameNotExistingException, ColorAlreadyPickedException, UnknownPlayerException, IllegalArgumentException
      Checks if the specified player can pick a color for their pawn based on game rules and current state.
      Specified by:
      canPickColor in interface RemoteGameController
      Parameters:
      player - The nickname of the player attempting to pick a color.
      color - The color chosen by the player as a String representation ("RED", "BLUE", "GREEN", "YELLOW").
      Throws:
      PlayerNotInTurnException - If it's not the player's turn to perform this action.
      InvalidStateException - If the game state does not allow picking a color.
      GameNotExistingException - If the game model is null, indicating the game does not exist.
      ColorAlreadyPickedException - If the chosen color has already been picked by another player.
      UnknownPlayerException - If the specified player is not part of the game or is not connected.
      IllegalArgumentException - If the color parameter does not match any valid color.

    • pickColor

      public void pickColor(String player, String color)
      Allows the specified player to pick a color for their pawn. This method assumes that all necessary validations (like player's turn and game state) have been performed before calling this method.
      Specified by:
      pickColor in interface RemoteGameController
      Parameters:
      player - The nickname of the player who is picking a color.
      color - The color chosen by the player as a String representation ("RED", "BLUE", "GREEN", "YELLOW").

    • handleCrashedPlayer

      public void handleCrashedPlayer(String nickname)
      Handles the disconnection of a player from the game. Adjusts game state and notifies remaining players and subscribers accordingly. If only one player remains connected, starts a timer for potential reconnection.
      Parameters:
      nickname - The nickname of the player who has disconnected.

    • rejoinGame

      public void rejoinGame(String nickname, String connectionType) throws InvalidStateException, GameNotExistingException, UnknownPlayerException
      Reconnects a player to the game using the specified connection type. Updates player connection status, increments connected player count, and manages timers based on current game state and connection type.
      Specified by:
      rejoinGame in interface RemoteGameController
      Parameters:
      nickname - The nickname of the player reconnecting.
      connectionType - The type of connection used ("RMI" or other).
      Throws:
      InvalidStateException - If the game state does not allow player reconnection.
      GameNotExistingException - If the game does not exist.
      UnknownPlayerException - If the player is not recognized as part of the game.

    • startTimer

      public void startTimer()
      Starts a timer that monitors the game state and ends the game if conditions are met. The timer will only start if it hasn't been started before. If fewer than 2 players are connected during the timer's execution, the game will be ended.

    • stopTimer

      public void stopTimer()
      Stops the timer and cancels its associated thread. Prints a message indicating that the timer has been interrupted.

    • setLastHeartBeat

      public void setLastHeartBeat(String player)
      Updates the last heartbeat timestamp for the specified player in the list of heartbeats.
      Specified by:
      setLastHeartBeat in interface RemoteGameController
      Parameters:
      player - The player whose heartbeat timestamp needs to be updated.

    • checkHeartBeats

      public void checkHeartBeats()
      Checks the heartbeats of players and handles those who have not sent a heartbeat in over 5 seconds. Removes subscriptions and handles crashed players accordingly.

    • getGameModel

      public Game getGameModel()
      Retrieves the game model associated with this instance.
      Returns:
      The Game object representing the game model.

    • sendGroupText

      public void sendGroupText(String sender, String text)
      Sends a group text message to all players in the game model.
      Specified by:
      sendGroupText in interface RemoteGameController
      Parameters:
      sender - The sender of the message.
      text - The text message to be sent.

    • canSendGroupChat

      public void canSendGroupChat(String sender, String text) throws BadTextException, InvalidStateException, GameNotExistingException, UnknownPlayerException
      Checks if the sender can send a group chat message based on game state and player status.
      Specified by:
      canSendGroupChat in interface RemoteGameController
      Parameters:
      sender - The sender of the message.
      text - The text message to be sent.
      Throws:
      BadTextException - If either sender or text is empty.
      InvalidStateException - If the game state does not allow sending a group chat.
      GameNotExistingException - If the game model is not initialized.
      UnknownPlayerException - If the sender is not part of the game or not connected.

    • sendPrivateText

      public void sendPrivateText(String sender, String receiver, String text)
      Sends a private text message from sender to receiver using the game model.
      Specified by:
      sendPrivateText in interface RemoteGameController
      Parameters:
      sender - The sender of the message.
      receiver - The recipient of the message.
      text - The text message to be sent.

    • canSendPrivateChat

      public void canSendPrivateChat(String sender, String receiver, String text) throws PlayerAbsentException, BadTextException, InvalidStateException, ParametersException, GameNotExistingException, UnknownPlayerException
      Checks if the sender can send a private chat message based on game state, player status, and message parameters.
      Specified by:
      canSendPrivateChat in interface RemoteGameController
      Parameters:
      sender - The sender of the message.
      receiver - The recipient of the message.
      text - The text message to be sent.
      Throws:
      PlayerAbsentException - If the receiver is not part of the game or has crashed.
      BadTextException - If either sender, receiver, or text is empty.
      InvalidStateException - If the game state does not allow sending a private chat.
      ParametersException - If sender tries to send a message to themselves.
      GameNotExistingException - If the game model is not initialized.
      UnknownPlayerException - If the sender or receiver is not part of the game or not connected.

    • rejoinedChief

      public void rejoinedChief(String player)
      Notifies all players except the rejoined player and performs game state management after a player rejoins.
      Specified by:
      rejoinedChief in interface RemoteGameController
      Parameters:
      player - The player who has rejoined.

    • isTimer

      public boolean isTimer()
      Returns:
      true when just one player is still connected
